page.title: 15A TEENAGER IN HOUSTON
page.content: Young people feel that the village lacks things to do. Much spare time is spent elsewhere. Glasgow and Paisley have good shops and cafes, Bridge of Weir has good golf courses and Linwood has a well equipped sports centre.This involves travel costs and time. The local schools run clubs during the day,e.g.chess,debating,volleyball,and during most evenings e.g.film club. On Mondays the youth club is open to 12 to 16 year olds. Local rivers have fishing clubs. 'Nightlife' is confined to occasional junior discos in the village hall with 3 pubs for the over 18s. {*********** {* CREDITS *} {*********** {Thanks to D.Blackwood for slides, {Kathleen Morgan and Annette Wilson for {the data and G.Whitelock for editing.}
